I never understood why they changed the rank system in the first place. One day I logged back into the game after a long break and noticed rank is different. Checked what it means and immediately thought to myself "This is just cosmetic bullshit that doesn't even hint at someones skill." It's literally a bottleneck on both ends to keep people from fluidly transitioning based on skill.

Failed my promo's 7 times to silver 2. It sucks because it's 90% luck, it just depends on your teammates in those 3 important games. I rarely lose my lane. If the system worked upon a basic MMR calculation, if you do well in all of your games, and win most of them then you would do well. But making everything rest upon 3 or 5 specific games leaves way too much to chance.

I think promotions/demotions are fine the way they are. I have been playing league for a few seasons now and only been demoted twice, but it took 2 games each time. I have even had some instances where I have lost 4 games at 0 LP and not been demoted so for you to lose 1 game and be demoted...I mean no offense but you must have been playing pretty bad leading up to it.

Ok while I don't think the promotion system is amazing, it does generally a decent job of showing your "mmr" anyways. Hell you could just minus your wins from your losses, multiply by an arbitrary average number (20 for dota, maybe 10 for LoL?) to get your mmr.

Like im at 560 wins 400 losses in Dota 2, I have 5500 mmr, you start 2300. 160 extra wins times 20 mmr avg per win = 3200 difference.

I think you start about 1200 in LoL and seems like roughly +/- 10 average so go ahead and figure out your mmr xD

Cept all the times where you are improving and trying to improve your mmr, and get up a rank to continue improving, and you get afk's and/or the worst possible teamates to screw you out of your promo's.

Going up a rank doesn't help you to continue improving. If you improve so much then it won't matter anyways. I failed a promo 4 times last week and on the 5th time I had won so many games outside of promo that it just skipped me a rank without doing promo. So if you really improve too much and have bad luck on promo then even promo won't hold you back.

>Hell you could just minus your wins from your losses, multiply by an arbitrary average number (20 for dota, maybe 10 for LoL?) to get your mmr.

Except LoL's MMR system uses a much more sophisticated system that takes into consideration who you're playing against. If you beat a team who the system you win less, you also lose more for losing against that team. The reverse is true against a team that's stronger than you. 

Also placements have a bigger impact on your MMR. If I were to win 10 placements then lose 10 regular games my MMR would be at around 1500, despite me having a 50% win rate.

Every mmr/elo system is like this but over a large amount of games you still end up with an average which is uses as a baseline. So baseline is 10 and you win say 13/7 if teams are unbalanced. You can already see this in LP gain/loss
with that system I'm a low silver LOL.
417 - 389 = +280 mmr-ish so that would put you high gold/low plat.
1480 MMR is still silver. 1500 is gold. =(

Yah the main problem with calculating like this is when someone experiences a sudden rise in winrate. like your 300 win 300 loss and then you suddenly main a champ for 66% winrate and shoot up in your last 150 games at 100-50 score.
Never had that happen though. i was always 20-30 wins above losses and had mained Yi and Hecarim since last year.
If my hatred for ranked could manifest itself into something, it would be this post.
They need to fix the gains vs loss of LP at least. At the worst it should make you lose the amount of lp u gained, not more than that.
The amounts all are based on your MMR compared to your rank.  I'm in Silver V and I'm gaining about 30 LP per win and losing about 8 LP per loss because my MMR is higher than my rank.

I know how the fuck the ranking works. My only issue is that after busting my ass and dealing with trolls and feeders, if I manage to pull myself out of Bronze. then I shouldn't have to deal with issues like gaining 10 lp and losing 20 lp JUST BECAUSE the system thinks I do not belong to Silver. It is actively trying to pull me down even though I pulled myself to Silver with legit progress. Agreed Im having a bad month and usually win 1 and then lose 1 game but that doesn't mean  the system should add it's own shit to make it difficult for me.. The trolls and afk's are punishment enough.
There is just as much chance for a troll or afk on your team as your opponent's team.
